template.name: Template OS Linux by Prom
template.description:
Official Linux template using node exporter.
Known Issues:
Description: node_exporter v0.16.0 renamed many metrics. CPU utilisation for 'guest' and 'guest_nice' metrics are not supported in this template with node_exporter < 0.16. Disk IO metrics are not supported. Other metrics provided as 'best effort'. See https://github.com/prometheus/node_exporter/releases/tag/v0.16.0 for details. Version: below 0.16.0
Description: metric node_network_info with label 'device' cannot be found, so network discovery is not possible. Version: below 0.18
You can discuss this template or leave feedback on our forum https://www.zabbix.com/forum/zabbix-suggestions-and-feedback/387225-discussion-thread-for-official-zabbix-template-for-linux
Template tooling version used: 0.30

item.name: System description
item.description: Labeled system information as provided by the uname system call.

step.params: var info = JSON.parse(value)[0]; return info.labels.sysname+' version: '+info.labels.release+' '+info.labels.version

item.name: Maximum number of open file descriptors
item.description: It could be increased by using sysctrl utility or modifying file /etc/sysctl.conf.

step.params: //count the number of cores return JSON.parse(value).length

item.name: CPU idle time
item.description: The time the CPU has spent doing nothing.

item.name: CPU system time
item.description: The time the CPU has spent running the kernel and its processes.

item.name: CPU user time
item.description: The time the CPU has spent running users' processes that are not niced.

item.name: CPU steal time
item.description: The amount of CPU 'stolen' from this virtual machine by the hypervisor for other tasks (such as running another virtual machine).

item.name: CPU softirq time
item.description: The amount of time the CPU has been servicing software interrupts.

item.name: CPU nice time
item.description: The time the CPU has spent running users' processes that have been niced.

item.name: CPU iowait time
item.description: Amount of time the CPU has been waiting for I/O to complete.

item.name: CPU interrupt time
item.description: The amount of time the CPU has been servicing hardware interrupts.

item.name: CPU guest time
item.description: Guest time (time spent running a virtual CPU for a guest operating system)

item.name: CPU guest nice time
item.description: Time spent running a niced guest (virtual CPU for guest operating systems under the control of the Linux kernel)

item.name: Memory utilization
item.description: Memory used percentage is calculated as (total-available)/total*100

item.name: Available memory
item.description: Available memory, in Linux, available = free + buffers + cache. On other platforms calculation may vary. See also: https://www.zabbix.com/documentation/current/manual/appendix/items/vm.memory.size_params

discovery_rule.name: Network interface discovery
discovery_rule.description: Discovery of network interfaces. Requires node_exporter v0.18 and up.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Speed
item_prototype.description: Sets value to 0 if metric is missing in node_exporter output.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Operational status
item_prototype.description: Indicates the interface RFC2863 operational state as a string. Possible values are:"unknown", "notpresent", "down", "lowerlayerdown", "testing","dormant", "up". Reference: https://www.kernel.org/doc/Documentation/ABI/testing/sysfs-class-net

trigger_prototype.expression: ({Template OS Linux by Prom:net.if.in[node_exporter,"{#IFNAME}"].avg(15m)}>({$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}/100)*{Template OS Linux by Prom:net.if.speed[node_exporter,"{#IFNAME}"].last()} or {Template OS Linux by Prom:net.if.out[node_exporter,"{#IFNAME}"].avg(15m)}>({$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}/100)*{Template OS Linux by Prom:net.if.speed[node_exporter,"{#IFNAME}"].last()}) and {Template OS Linux by Prom:net.if.speed[node_exporter,"{#IFNAME}"].last()}>0
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: {Template OS Linux by Prom:net.if.in[node_exporter,"{#IFNAME}"].avg(15m)}<(({$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}-3)/100)*{Template OS Linux by Prom:net.if.speed[node_exporter,"{#IFNAME}"].last()} and {Template OS Linux by Prom:net.if.out[node_exporter,"{#IFNAME}"].avg(15m)}<(({$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}-3)/100)*{Template OS Linux by Prom:net.if.speed[node_exporter,"{#IFNAME}"].last()}
trigger_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): High bandwidth usage ( > {$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}% )

dependency.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Link down
dependency.expression: {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 and ({Template OS Linux by Prom:net.if.status[node_exporter,"{#IFNAME}"].last()}=2 and {Template OS Linux by Prom:net.if.status[node_exporter,"{#IFNAME}"].diff()}=1)

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template OS Linux by Prom:net.if.in.errors[node_exporter,"{#IFNAME}"].min(5m)}>{$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"} or {Template OS Linux by Prom:net.if.out.errors[node_exporter"{#IFNAME}"].min(5m)}>{$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"}
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: {Template OS Linux by Prom:net.if.in.errors[node_exporter,"{#IFNAME}"].max(5m)}<{$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"}*0.8 and {Template OS Linux by Prom:net.if.out.errors[node_exporter"{#IFNAME}"].max(5m)}<{$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"}*0.8
trigger_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): High error rate ( > {$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"} for 5m)
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. Recovers when below 80% of {$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"} threshold

dependency.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Link down
dependency.expression: {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 and ({Template OS Linux by Prom:net.if.status[node_exporter,"{#IFNAME}"].last()}=2 and {Template OS Linux by Prom:net.if.status[node_exporter,"{#IFNAME}"].diff()}=1)

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template OS Linux by Prom:net.if.speed[node_exporter,"{#IFNAME}"].change()}<0 and {Template OS Linux by Prom:net.if.speed[node_exporter,"{#IFNAME}"].last()}>0 and ( {Template OS Linux by Prom:net.if.type[node_exporter,"{#IFNAME}"].last()}=6 or {Template OS Linux by Prom:net.if.type[node_exporter,"{#IFNAME}"].last()}=7 or {Template OS Linux by Prom:net.if.type[node_exporter,"{#IFNAME}"].last()}=11 or {Template OS Linux by Prom:net.if.type[node_exporter,"{#IFNAME}"].last()}=62 or {Template OS Linux by Prom:net.if.type[node_exporter,"{#IFNAME}"].last()}=69 or {Template OS Linux by Prom:net.if.type[node_exporter,"{#IFNAME}"].last()}=117 ) and ({Template OS Linux by Prom:net.if.status[node_exporter,"{#IFNAME}"].last()}<>2)
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: ({Template OS Linux by Prom:net.if.speed[node_exporter,"{#IFNAME}"].change()}>0 and {Template OS Linux by Prom:net.if.speed[node_exporter,"{#IFNAME}"].prev()}>0) or ({Template OS Linux by Prom:net.if.status[node_exporter,"{#IFNAME}"].last()}=2)
trigger_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Ethernet has changed to lower speed than it was before
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. This Ethernet connection has transitioned down from its known maximum speed. This might be a sign of autonegotiation issues. Ack to close.

dependency.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Link down
dependency.expression: {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 and ({Template OS Linux by Prom:net.if.status[node_exporter,"{#IFNAME}"].last()}=2 and {Template OS Linux by Prom:net.if.status[node_exporter,"{#IFNAME}"].diff()}=1)

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template OS Linux by Prom:net.if.type[node_exporter,"{#IFNAME}"].change()}<0 and {Template OS Linux by Prom:net.if.type[node_exporter,"{#IFNAME}"].last()}>0 and ({Template OS Linux by Prom:net.if.type[node_exporter,"{#IFNAME}"].last()}=6 or {Template OS Linux by Prom:net.if.type[node_exporter,"{#IFNAME}"].last()}=1) and ({Template OS Linux by Prom:net.if.status[node_exporter,"{#IFNAME}"].last()}<>2)
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: ({Template OS Linux by Prom:net.if.type[node_exporter,"{#IFNAME}"].change()}>0 and {Template OS Linux by Prom:net.if.type[node_exporter,"{#IFNAME}"].prev()}>0) or ({Template OS Linux by Prom:net.if.status[node_exporter,"{#IFNAME}"].last()}=2)
trigger_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Ethernet has changed to lower speed than it was before
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. This Ethernet connection has transitioned down from its known maximum speed. This might be a sign of autonegotiation issues. Ack to close.

dependency.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Link down
dependency.expression: {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 and ({Template OS Linux by Prom:net.if.status[node_exporter,"{#IFNAME}"].last()}=2 and {Template OS Linux by Prom:net.if.status[node_exporter,"{#IFNAME}"].diff()}=1)

trigger_prototype.expression: {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 and ({Template OS Linux by Prom:net.if.status[node_exporter,"{#IFNAME}"].last()}=2 and {Template OS Linux by Prom:net.if.status[node_exporter,"{#IFNAME}"].diff()}=1)
trigger_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Link down
trigger_prototype.description:
Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. This trigger expression works as follows: 1. Can be triggered if operations status is down. 2. {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 - user can redefine Context macro to value - 0. That marks this interface as not important. No new trigger will be fired if this interface is down. 3. {TEMPLATE_NAME:METRIC.diff()}=1) - trigger fires only if operational status was up(1) sometime before. (So, do not fire 'ethernal off' interfaces.)
WARNING: if closed manually - won't fire again on next poll, because of .diff.

discovery_rule.name: Mounted filesystem discovery
discovery_rule.description: Discovery of file systems of different types.

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template OS Linux by Prom:vfs.fs.pused[node_exporter,"{#FSNAME}"].last()}>{$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"} and (({Template OS Linux by Prom:vfs.fs.total[node_exporter,"{#FSNAME}"].last()}-{Template OS Linux by Prom:vfs.fs.used[node_exporter,"{#FSNAME}"].last()})<5G or {Template OS Linux by Prom:vfs.fs.pused[node_exporter,"{#FSNAME}"].timeleft(1h,,100)}<1d)
trigger_prototype.name: {#FSNAME}: Disk space is critically low (used > {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"}%)
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. Space used: {ITEM.VALUE3} of {ITEM.VALUE2} ({ITEM.VALUE1}), time left till full: < 24h. Two conditions should match: First, space utilization should be above {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"}. Second condition should be one of the following: - The disk free space is less than 5G. - The disk will be full in less than 24hours.

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template OS Linux by Prom:vfs.fs.pused[node_exporter,"{#FSNAME}"].last()}>{$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.WARN:"{#FSNAME}"} and (({Template OS Linux by Prom:vfs.fs.total[node_exporter,"{#FSNAME}"].last()}-{Template OS Linux by Prom:vfs.fs.used[node_exporter,"{#FSNAME}"].last()})<10G or {Template OS Linux by Prom:vfs.fs.pused[node_exporter,"{#FSNAME}"].timeleft(1h,,100)}<1d)
trigger_prototype.name: {#FSNAME}: Disk space is low (used > {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.WARN:"{#FSNAME}"}%)
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. Space used: {ITEM.VALUE3} of {ITEM.VALUE2} ({ITEM.VALUE1}), time left till full: < 24h. Two conditions should match: First, space utilization should be above {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"}. Second condition should be one of the following: - The disk free space is less than 10G. - The disk will be full in less than 24hours.

dependency.name: {#FSNAME}: Disk space is critically low (used > {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"}%)
dependency.expression: {Template OS Linux by Prom:vfs.fs.pused[node_exporter,"{#FSNAME}"].last()}>{$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"} and (({Template OS Linux by Prom:vfs.fs.total[node_exporter,"{#FSNAME}"].last()}-{Template OS Linux by Prom:vfs.fs.used[node_exporter,"{#FSNAME}"].last()})<5G or {Template OS Linux by Prom:vfs.fs.pused[node_exporter,"{#FSNAME}"].timeleft(1h,,100)}<1d)

trigger_prototype.name: {#FSNAME}: Running out of free inodes (free < {$VFS.FS.INODE.PFREE.MIN.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"}%)
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. It may become impossible to write to disk if there are no index nodes left. As symptoms, 'No space left on device' or 'Disk is full' errors may be seen even though free space is available.

trigger_prototype.name: {#FSNAME}: Running out of free inodes (free < {$VFS.FS.INODE.PFREE.MIN.WARN:"{#FSNAME}"}%)
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. It may become impossible to write to disk if there are no index nodes left. As symptoms, 'No space left on device' or 'Disk is full' errors may be seen even though free space is available.

item_prototype.name: {#DEVNAME}: Disk read rate
item_prototype.description: r/s. The number (after merges) of read requests completed per second for the device.

item_prototype.name: {#DEVNAME}: Disk write rate
item_prototype.description: w/s. The number (after merges) of write requests completed per second for the device.

item_prototype.name: {#DEVNAME}: Disk read time (rate)
item_prototype.description: Rate of total read time counter. Used in r_await calculation

item_prototype.name: {#DEVNAME}: Disk write time (rate)
item_prototype.description: Rate of total write time counter. Used in w_await calculation

item_prototype.name: {#DEVNAME}: Disk read request avg waiting time (r_await)
item_prototype.description: This formula contains two boolean expressions that evaluates to 1 or 0 in order to set calculated metric to zero and to avoid division by zero exception.

item_prototype.name: {#DEVNAME}: Disk write request avg waiting time (w_await)
item_prototype.description: This formula contains two boolean expressions that evaluates to 1 or 0 in order to set calculated metric to zero and to avoid division by zero exception.

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template OS Linux by Prom:vfs.dev.read.await[node_exporter,"{#DEVNAME}"].min(15m)} > {$VFS.DEV.READ.AWAIT.WARN:"{#DEVNAME}"} or {Template OS Linux by Prom:vfs.dev.read.await[node_exporter,"{#DEVNAME}"].min(15m)} > {$VFS.DEV.WRITE.AWAIT.WARN:"{#DEVNAME}"}
trigger_prototype.name: {#DEVNAME}: Disk read request response are too high (read > {$VFS.DEV.READ.AWAIT.WARN:"{#DEVNAME}"} ms for 15m or write > {$VFS.DEV.WRITE.AWAIT.WARN:"{#DEVNAME}"} ms for 15m)
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. This trigger might indicate disk {#DEVNAME} saturation.

trigger.name: node_exporter is not available (or no data for 30m)
trigger.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. Failed to fetch system metrics from node_exporter in time.

trigger.name: System time is out of sync (diff with Zabbix server > {$SYSTEM.FUZZYTIME.MAX}s)

trigger.expression: {Template OS Linux by Prom:system.name[node_exporter].diff()}=1 and {Template OS Linux by Prom:system.name[node_exporter].strlen()}>0
trigger.name: Systen name has changed (new name: {ITEM.VALUE})
trigger.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. System name has changed. Ack to close.

trigger.name: Configured max number of open filedescriptors is too low (< {$KERNEL.MAXFILES.MIN})

dependency.name: Running out of file descriptors (less than < 20% free)
dependency.expression: {Template OS Linux by Prom:fd.open[node_exporter].last()}/{Template OS Linux by Prom:kernel.maxfiles[node_exporter].last()}*100>80

trigger.expression: {Template OS Linux by Prom:fd.open[node_exporter].last()}/{Template OS Linux by Prom:kernel.maxfiles[node_exporter].last()}*100>80
trigger.name: Running out of file descriptors (less than < 20% free)

trigger.expression: {Template OS Linux by Prom:system.sw.os[node_exporter].diff()}=1 and {Template OS Linux by Prom:system.sw.os[node_exporter].strlen()}>0
trigger.name: Operating system description has changed
trigger.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. Operating system description has changed. Possible reasons that system has been updated or replaced. Ack to close.

dependency.name: Systen name has changed (new name: {ITEM.VALUE})
dependency.expression: {Template OS Linux by Prom:system.name[node_exporter].diff()}=1 and {Template OS Linux by Prom:system.name[node_exporter].strlen()}>0

trigger.name: {HOST.NAME} has been restarted (uptime < 10m)
trigger.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. The device uptime is less than 10 minutes

trigger.expression: {Template OS Linux by Prom:system.cpu.load.avg1[node_exporter].min(5m)}/{Template OS Linux by Prom:system.cpu.num[node_exporter].last()}>{$LOAD_AVG_PER_CPU.MAX.WARN}
trigger.name: Load average is too high (per CPU load over {$LOAD_AVG_PER_CPU.MAX.WARN} for 5m)
trigger.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. Per CPU load average is too high. Your system may be slow to respond.

dependency.name: Load average is too high (per CPU load over {$LOAD_AVG_PER_CPU.MAX.WARN} for 5m)
dependency.expression: {Template OS Linux by Prom:system.cpu.load.avg1[node_exporter].min(5m)}/{Template OS Linux by Prom:system.cpu.num[node_exporter].last()}>{$LOAD_AVG_PER_CPU.MAX.WARN}

dependency.name: Lack of available memory ( < {$MEMORY.AVAILABLE.MIN} of {ITEM.VALUE2})
dependency.expression: {Template OS Linux by Prom:vm.memory.available[node_exporter].min(5m)}<{$MEMORY.AVAILABLE.MIN} and {Template OS Linux by Prom:vm.memory.total[node_exporter].last()}>0

trigger.expression: {Template OS Linux by Prom:vm.memory.available[node_exporter].min(5m)}<{$MEMORY.AVAILABLE.MIN} and {Template OS Linux by Prom:vm.memory.total[node_exporter].last()}>0
trigger.name: Lack of available memory ( < {$MEMORY.AVAILABLE.MIN} of {ITEM.VALUE2})

trigger.expression: {Template OS Linux by Prom:system.swap.pfree[node_exporter].min(5m)}<{$SWAP.PFREE.MIN.WARN} and {Template OS Linux by Prom:system.swap.total[node_exporter].last()}>0
trigger.name: High swap space usage ( less than {$SWAP.PFREE.MIN.WARN}% free)
trigger.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. This trigger is ignored, if there is no swap configured

dependency.name: Lack of available memory ( < {$MEMORY.AVAILABLE.MIN} of {ITEM.VALUE2})
dependency.expression: {Template OS Linux by Prom:vm.memory.available[node_exporter].min(5m)}<{$MEMORY.AVAILABLE.MIN} and {Template OS Linux by Prom:vm.memory.total[node_exporter].last()}>0
